meanings.definition: The water or liquid that flows backwards or away from something, especially in a wave or tide.
meanings.sent1: After the wave crashed, the backwash carried the seaweed back into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The beach was wet from the backwash of the waves.
meanings.sent3: The backwash from the boat made the seagulls dance as they avoided getting wet.
meanings.sent4: The backwash of emotions flooded her heart as memories resurfaced.
meanings.sent5: The backwash of the river was so strong, it almost pulled me in.

meanings.definition: The residue or remnants left behind after something has passed through or been used.
meanings.sent1: The backwash of the storm left branches scattered across the yard.
meanings.sent2: The sink was clogged with the backwash of food scraps.
meanings.sent3: The backwash of popcorn crumbs made a trail from the couch to the TV.
meanings.sent4: The backwash of laughter lingered in the room long after the party ended.
meanings.sent5: The backwash of memories flooded her mind as she cleaned out the attic.

meanings.definition: To clean or rinse something by pouring water or liquid over it and letting it flow backwards or away.
meanings.sent1: She backwashed the sandcastle to make it sturdy.
meanings.sent2: He backwashed the glass to remove the soap suds.
meanings.sent3: The kids backwashed the toy cars in the puddle, pretending it was a car wash.
meanings.sent4: The rain backwashed the streets, washing away the dirt and grime.
meanings.sent5: She backwashed the paintbrush to remove the excess paint.
